briefdescription.para: Keep track of through which channel the ions have passed.
Domain identifier.

detaileddescription.para: Keeps track of from which compartment the ions came before passing the channel.

briefdescription.para: Structure containing compartment-specific data.
This structure contains data needed for the groups involved in swapping: split group 0, split group 1, solvent group, ion groups.
Main (private) data structure for the position swapping protocol.
For output that comes from the swap module.

Compartment name.
Name for the swap types.

Name for the domains.

memberdef.argsstring: (rvec point, rvec center, real d_up, real d_down, real r_cyl2, t_pbc *pbc, int normal)
memberdef.name: is_in_channel

briefdescription.para: Check whether point is in channel.

detaileddescription.para: A channel is a cylinder defined by a disc with radius r around its center c. The thickness of the cylinder is d_up - d_down.

parameterdescription.para: The position (xyz) under consideration.
The center of the cylinder.
The upper extension of the cylinder.
The lower extension.
Cylinder radius squared.
Structure with info about periodic boundary conditions.
The membrane normal direction is typically 3, i.e. z, but can be x or y also.

simplesect.para: Whether the point is inside the defined cylindric channel.

briefdescription.para: Prints output to CompEL output file.

detaileddescription.para: Prints to swap output file how many ions are in each compartment, where the centers of the split groups are, and how many ions of each type passed the channels.

memberdef.argsstring: (rvec x[], int nat, real *weights, rvec center, t_pbc *pbc)
memberdef.name: get_molecule_center

briefdescription.para: Get the center of a group of nat atoms.

detaileddescription.para: Since with PBC an atom group might not be whole, use the first atom as the reference atom and determine the center with respect to this reference.

memberdef.argsstring: (real w1, real w2, real x, real l, real bulkOffset, real *distance_from_b)
memberdef.name: compartment_contains_atom

briefdescription.para: Return TRUE if position x of ion (or water) is found in the compartment, i.e. between w1 and w2.

detaileddescription.para: One can define and additional offset "b" if one wants to exchange ions/water to or from a plane not directly in the middle of w1 and w2. The offset can be in ]-1.0, ..., +1.0 [. A bulkOffset of 0.0 means 'no offset', so the swap-layer is directly in the middle between w1 and w2. Offsets -1.0 < b < 0.0 will yield swaps nearer to w1, whereas offsets 0.0 < 0 < +1.0 will yield swaps nearer to w2.

w1
Position of 'wall' atom 1.
w2
Position of 'wall' atom 2.
x
Position of the ion or the water molecule under consideration.
l
Length of the box, from || to || in the sketch.
bulkOffset
Where is the bulk layer "b" to be found between w1 and w2?
distance_from_b
Distance of x to the bulk layer "b".
TRUE if x is between w1 and w2. Also computes the distance of x to the compartment center (the layer that is normally situated in the middle of w1 and w2 that would be considered as having the bulk concentration of ions).

briefdescription.para: Updates the time-averaged number of ions in a compartment.
Add the atom with collective index ci to the atom list in compartment 'comp'.

parameterdescription.para: Index of this ion in the collective xc array.
Compartment to add this atom to.
Shortest distance of this atom to the bulk layer, from which ion/water pairs are selected for swapping.

memberdef.argsstring: (int c, t_swap *s, const matrix box, real *left, real *right)
memberdef.name: get_compartment_boundaries

briefdescription.para: Determine the compartment boundaries from the channel centers.

memberdef.name: detect_flux_per_channel

briefdescription.para: Determine the per-channel ion flux.

detaileddescription.para: To determine the flux through the individual channels, we remember the compartment and channel history of each ion. An ion can be either in channel0 or channel1, or in the remaining volume of compartment A or B.

memberdef.argsstring: (t_swapgrp *g, t_commrec *cr, t_swapcoords *sc, const matrix box, gmx_int64_t step, FILE *fpout, gmx_bool bRerun, gmx_bool bIsSolvent)

briefdescription.para: Determines which ions or solvent molecules are in compartment A and B.

memberdef.name: get_initial_ioncounts

briefdescription.para: Find out how many group atoms are in the compartments initially.
Copy history of ion counts from checkpoint file.

detaileddescription.para: When called, the checkpoint file has already been read in. Here we copy over the values from .cpt file to the swap data structure.

briefdescription.para: The master lets all others know about the initial ion counts.
Ensure that each atom belongs to at most one of the swap groups.
Get the number of atoms per molecule for this group.

detaileddescription.para: Also ensure that all the molecules in this group have this number of atoms.

briefdescription.para: Print the legend to the swap output file.

detaileddescription.para: Also print the initial values of ion counts and position of split groups.

briefdescription.para: Initialize channel ion flux detection routine.

detaileddescription.para: Initialize arrays that keep track of where the ions come from and where they go.

memberdef.argsstring: (gmx_mtop_t *mtop, rvec *x, int ePBC, const matrix box)
memberdef.name: outputStartStructureIfWanted

briefdescription.para: Outputs the initial structure to PDB file for debugging reasons.

detaileddescription.para: Output the starting structure so that in case of multimeric channels the user can check whether we have the correct PBC image for all atoms. If this is not correct, the ion counts per channel will be very likely wrong.

memberdef.argsstring: (swaphistory_t *swapstate, t_swapcoords *sc, gmx_mtop_t *mtop, const rvec *x, const matrix box, t_inputrec *ir)
memberdef.name: init_swapstate

briefdescription.para: Initialize the swapstate structure, used for checkpoint writing.

detaileddescription.para: The swapstate struct stores the information we need to make the channels whole again after restarts from a checkpoint file. Here we do the following: a) If we did not start from .cpt, we prepare the struct for proper .cpt writing, b) if we did start from .cpt, we copy over the last whole structures from .cpt, c) in any case, for subsequent checkpoint writing, we set the pointers in swapstate to the x_old arrays, which contain the correct PBC representation of multimeric channels at the last time step.

briefdescription.para: Determine the total charge imbalance resulting from the swap groups.
Sorts anions and cations into two separate groups.

detaileddescription.para: This routine should be called for the 'anions' and 'cations' group, of which the indices were lumped together in the older version of the code.

briefdescription.para: Converts old .tpr file CompEL contents to new data layout.

detaileddescription.para: If we have read an old .tpr file (tpxv <= tpxv_CompElPolyatomicIonsAndMultipleIonTypes), anions and cations are stored together in group #3. In the new format we store each ion type in a separate group. The 'classic' groups are: #0 split group 0 - OK #1 split group 1 - OK #2 solvent - OK #3 anions - contains also cations, needs to be converted #4 cations - empty before conversion

briefdescription.para: Returns TRUE if we started from an old .tpr.

detaileddescription.para: Then we need to re-sort anions and cations into separate groups

memberdef.argsstring: (FILE *fplog, t_inputrec *ir, const char *fn, gmx_mtop_t *mtop, const t_state *globalState, ObservablesHistory *oh, t_commrec *cr, const gmx_output_env_t *oenv, const MdrunOptions &mdrunOptions)
memberdef.name: init_swapcoords

briefdescription.para: Initialize ion / water position swapping ("Computational Electrophysiology").

detaileddescription.para: This routine does the memory allocation for various helper arrays, opens the output file, sets up swap data checkpoint writing, etc.

parameterdescription.para: General output file, normally md.log.
Structure containing MD input parameters, among those also the structure needed for position swapping.
Output file name for swap data.
Molecular topology.
The global state, only used on the master rank.
Contains struct with swap data that is read from or written to checkpoint.
Pointer to MPI communication data.
Needed to open the swap output XVGR file.
Options for mdrun.

briefdescription.para: Finalizes ion / water position swapping.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to swap data.

briefdescription.para: Make a selection of the home atoms for the swap groups. These are the ions, the water, and the channels. This routine should be called at every domain decomposition.

parameterdescription.para: Structure containing domain decomposition data.
Pointer to the swap data structure.

briefdescription.para: Do we need to swap a molecule in any of the ion groups with a water molecule at this step?

detaileddescription.para: From the requested and average molecule counts we determine whether a swap is needed at this time step.

briefdescription.para: Return the index of an atom or molecule suitable for swapping.

detaileddescription.para: Returns the index of an atom that is far off the compartment boundaries, that is near to the bulk layer to/from which the swaps take place. Other atoms of the molecule (if any) will directly follow the returned index.

parameterdescription.para: Structure containing compartment-specific data.
Name of the molecule.

simplesect.para: Index of the first atom of the molecule chosen for a position exchange.

briefdescription.para: Swaps centers of mass and makes molecule whole if broken.
Write back the the modified local positions from the collective array to the official positions.
